aboutMe.title: ABOUT ME
aboutMe.content:
I was born and raised in İzmir, and for as long as I can remember, I’ve been fascinated by electronics and computers. My curiosity started with a simple question to my parents: Where do all the deleted files go? That curiosity quickly turned into a passion for understanding how things work, often by taking them apart to see what’s the engineering like inside.
Over the years, this drive led me to programming and engineering, where I find joy in building things from scratch and experimenting with new ideas. I enjoy working on hobby projects and constantly seek opportunities to learn and refine my skills. My passion for design also plays a big role in my creative process; I spend much of my free time in software like Photoshop and Blender, exploring both technical and artistic aspects of digital creation.
Beyond technology, I am a dedicated motorsports fan, always intrigued by the engineering brilliance behind racing. Whether it's programming, design, or engineering, I thrive on innovation, problem-solving, and pushing boundaries.

content.python: Extensive experience in app developement, data science and machine learning

content.note: Indicated knowledge level is based on personal assessment and relative to my working areas

subjects.line1: High Voltage Circuit and Load Breakers
Full stack web development with Django

hackathon.name: Winner of the Smart Cities Hackathon
hackathon.description: Our project, Acil Geçiş İkaz Sistemi [Emergency Passage Alert System] (AGİS), aims to improve emergency response efficiency by allowing drivers to be aware of incoming emergency vehicles by using navigation apps and on-road digital warning signs.
hackathon.organizer: Organised by Elektrik Mühendisleri Odası (EMO) İzmir Şubesi, İzmir İnovasyon ve Teknoloji A.Ş ve İzQ İnovasyon Merkezi

project1.title: Tester-Developer Portal
project1.description:
In my internship at SCW.AI, after changing their case report system, they needed a portal website for both developers and testers to access. I was given the task of developing this website. The Website had:
‣ Django templates
‣ AJAX implementation
‣ Dark and Light modes
‣ Google Login
‣ Two search functions for case_id and title using the new system's API which are automatically seperated at the backend; CASE ID and TITLE
‣ Pop-up image displays

project1.title: RL_driver<sup>[WIP]</sup>
project1.description: My hobby project which aims to use a Reinforcement Learning model to create a self driving racing car. Which then is used to compute the ideal racing line.

project2.title: MFBC
project2.description: My TÜBİTAK 1002 submisson and also my degree finishing project. Math Function Based Convolution. This code passes coefficient of variation to a kernel of math functions (sin, cos, exp etc.) to convolve each RGB channel.

project3.title: BoarRepellent
project3.description: My first monetized project. This project aims to use different sound effects to scare the invasive boars that roam in the dark hours in farming areas.

project4.title: EmbeddedProjects
project4.description: A repo that includes the projects I made for Embedded Systems and IoT classes.

project5.title: SignalZeroOverlapper
project5.description: This project overlaps the zero points of given signals.

project6.title: BasicImageFiltering
project6.description: Includes low level image processing to create a social media-like filter.

project7.title: BruteForceAttack
project7.description: Just a pastime project. It works by trying every combination of 94 ASCII characters. Mean Measured Time for 5 char passwords is around 20 minutes. Still to be improved.

project8.title: CodesysLecture
project8.description: For a lecture I had given for the PLC class.

project9.title: PythonLectures
project9.description: Lecture notes that I have created for our IEEE Student Branch lessons.

project10.title: DSP_Doppler_ECG_Resp
project10.description: Digital processing and filtering of a Doppler Radar signal to estimate the heartrate and respiration rate.

project11.title: DataScienceGeoSpatial
project11.description: Using adress names to geolocate and visualise several data. A group project for a uni class.

project12.title: CursorMaze
project12.description: My first programming project ever. A GUI maze puzzle that you follow through with your mouse without colliding with the walls.

project13.title: ShutdownTimer
project13.description: A GUI project that sets a countdown timer to shutdown your pc.
